author: @aaronspoor6425
text:
the one critique that some of the guys have had on Hassan is that he is not more in-depth with theory and principles and is more just a reactionary activist, but IMO Hassan is a great ally in the struggle because of his approach of memeing/reactionary to current issues/not doing a 3 hour long stream on a poli-sci theory is what is welcoming new and younger audience members to our movement and giving them enough information/insight to peak their interest so that they themselves can begin their journey into reading more/learning more about everything at their own pace. The fact he has 10s of thousands everyday watching him engage with the modern worlds conflict of capitalism vs socialism is one of the best methods of getting our ranks up.

He may not be a good fit for more radical members who have already done years in school learning it all, or are more boots on ground activists in the fight, but he is also a staunch support of alot of programs that he donates to, if he cant be a more boots on ground fighter, he atleast uses his privilage to help fund causes that he agrees with and encourages other to do the same.

author: @automaton111
text: Prices to the end consumers for healthcare services do not necessarily need to be as high as the cost. This is because we have a free floating fiat currency that the federal government issues into existence and spends into existence. So we can pay workers whatever we want to entice them to do the jobs, and then we can charge people whatever we want as well. We could technically pay people to consume certain health services if we wanted to.

replies.author: @leafphoenix3364
replies.text: Curious could decentralized planned economy work under communism or would it undermine the state?

replies.author: @automaton111
replies.text: @leafphoenix3364Like democratically planned economy? That would depend entirely on every other detail of how society is run, what the new laws and constitution permitted, etc. It would be very susceptible to the influence of moneyed interests the same way people are tricked into voting against their best interests under capitalism today. At a small scale like a worker owned co-op it is possible for it to work when everybody is given all of the behind-the-scenes details and numbers and everyone is invested in the same outcome. Add a large scale it probably does not work. You might be able to have local Democratic control within the guidelines of higher level controls.

replies.author: @leafphoenix3364
replies.text: @automaton111 Ah thanks I guess it would be tricky large scale. I‚Äôve been looking into different ideologies related to Socialism/Communism. It was mentioned in Syndicalism and I think Luxembourgism maybe? Just looking for something that I can get behind and truly believe in. Thanks again for the reply.

replies.author: @automaton111
replies.text: @leafphoenix3364 I mean, you could vote on things like ballot measures like we do now. But the system would have to be way cleaned up compared to how it is.

author: @klimentbassev8866
text: This makes me so happy. The jubilee video is overall a giant leap  for leftist sentiment.‚ù§

author: @Pyskiper
text:
I think a issue with the jubilee video was that it sometimes sounded like China vs USA and i think maybe it would have been more beneficial to go away from that and talk about the socialist policies in norway for example, especially when the capitalist side sometimes brought some of these countries up as good capitalist examples, when in reality a big reason on why Quality of Life is so high there is because of government regulations and social policies that restrict Capitalism

And a lot of the times it seemed like the Capitalists in the Jubilee video blamed everything wrong in for example china or Cuba on Communism and maybe that needed some pushback so that a viewer just picks that up and realizes that a lot of the shortcomings of the ‚Äûcommunist‚Äú countries are not because of communism but because of other factors like the Embargo on Cuba for example. Also the fact that they constantly went for civil liberties being restricted in dictatorships as being a communism issue.
I mean the capitalists in the video would not be susceptible to counterarguments there i am sure but it would maybe have been good to still give them to educate viewers in that regard and not let the capitalists run those talking points and pocket the viewers on those things.

All in all i think you did really well and with all due respect to the capitalists in the video but in my opinion the communists looked a lot smarter and well learned here.

author: @Justin_Watson23
text:
Good thing I talked to my family first, meeting them where they are, & now they all have a materialist perspective, & I'm very thankful for that.

I mention that bc 2 years ago (or so), Hasan would have referred to other poor/working people with the same type of false consciousness they had as "Hogs".

This is a great channel/institute, but I have absolutely ZERO respect for Hasan Piker. Not the type of "middle class radicalism" you want to ally with‚Äîif you want to even have a chance to nudge the people in the direction of dialectical materialism‚Äîwhich I believe you guys are currently doing a great job of doing.

replies.text: Oh please

replies.author: @Justin_Watson23
replies.text: @degummybear if I'm off, missing something, or am flat out wrong, tell me why. I value the opinion of a working class person far more than some middle class "radical" on Twitch.

replies.author: @69niceGoatboy
replies.text:
Firstly Hasan deprograms a massive amount of right wingers and is a huge pipeline to the left.
On a more basic level the rightwing are the political enemy. If they have a political awakening they are not. Out reach and education are important. Mocking them, when IMO they are traitors to our class, being unforgivable is ridiculous. 
If you believe members of the working class that pivot to fascism as the contradictions of capitalism worsen are our comrades over someone like Hasan, I honestly don‚Äôt know how to have that conversation.@Justin_Watson23

replies.author: @bul34
replies.text: The ones he calls "hogs" are republicans, or just conservatives in general. How is doing that, as an inside joke, the reason you have zero respect for him? The "hogs" would never listen to anything he says regardless, so why not have some fun? I personally don't see how that's a problem. And besides, he's still very much on our side despite not being the ideal "working class" person, empathy goes a long way. Sorry for rambling lol

author: @ROB91288
text: I think that hasan is a good communicator but I don't think it makes sense that Hasan lives in a million dollar home while the proleteriat is starving.

replies.author: @ranch_dip-y1g
replies.text: Million dollar home is the norm in California, especially in LA. The average home price in my area for a single family home is about 900k. Attack systems and be kind to people my brother. The proletariat suffers because our systems commodified living in a house.

replies.author: @ericktellez7632
replies.text: That makes no sense, you live inside the united states while the rest of us have half your life expectancy. What matters is how he amassed his wealth and what he does with it, you can‚Äôt consume anything ethically under a capitalist economy and the prices for goods and services are dictated by a market outside of the control of Hasan, what he could realistically do is move to a cheaper state, but whats the point if he can do what he does as ethically as possible in California anyways.

replies.text: socialism is not a poverty cult

replies.text: Honestly worrying about someone with a million+ dollar house (keep in mind insane property prices in L.A.) and a nice car is missing the forest for the trees. Socialism is not a poverty cult and his wealth is such a insignificant portion of that accumulated by the people doing the vast majority of capitalist exploitation.

replies.author: @ROB91288
replies.text: @rat_world yeah you‚Äôre right it‚Äôs insignificant in comparison I just don‚Äôt like it

replies.author: @MrTooEarnestOnline
replies.text: The proletariat has been shipped off over seas. What‚Äôs left of the proletariat here is starving yes, but your gripe isn‚Äôt with Hasan. Not all rich people are the problem. It‚Äôs about your relationship to the means of production

replies.author: @andjanice71
replies.text: There is a difference between private property and personal property. If someone has the means to live in a million dollar house, and got those means without exploiting others, they are welcome to do so. My main concerns about Piker are his support of most war efforts, and the fact that many of his arguments are often couched in PMC lingo, which really begins the debate already halfway conceding. If we allow the pmc to define the parameters, our job to convince others is made much more difficult because we have to first undo the damage done by the mis-framing of the debate to then redefine the parameters to our class perspective. I do appreciate when he gets something right though.

replies.author: @69niceGoatboy
replies.text:
What war efforts does he or has he supported? He has always stated that every war ends with a political settlement and that it is the working class that suffers in the meantime. 
Also in his vernacular "the US is never on the right side of a conflict, if we are on a side its the wrong one. Even if we were on the right side we would make it the wrong side. Only time we were on the right side was WW2 and we have milked it ever since."@andjanice71
